alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 1:59PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Castle, northwestern Cumberland, Salem and central Gloucester Counties through 230 PM EST... At 158 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Stanton to near Cecilton. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Bridgeton, Middletown, Glassboro, Pennsville, Clayton, Carneys Point, Elsmere, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Woodstown, Alloway, Quinton, Swedesboro, Delaware City, Elmer, Newport and Greenwich. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 1. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 2 and 18. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
